title: Vision
text: Our future vision is to develop a complete zero-waste system from water hyacinth, where stems are used for fiber, leaves are converted into paper and packaging, and roots are used for biogas production. Through this integrated approach, we aim to clean polluted water bodies while ensuring that no part of the plant is discarded. By combining environmental restoration with sustainable production, we envision a circular model that generates income, reduces pollution, and supports long-term community resilience.

section.title: Why water hyacinth?
section.content: Water hyacinth is one of Bangladesh’s most invasive aquatic plants, clogging rivers, harming biodiversity, and disrupting livelihoods—yet it is also a rich source of natural fiber when processed responsibly.

section.title: Why EcoValue Chain?
section.content: By building a low-cost, youth-led fiber extraction process, EcoValue Chain converts this waste into eco-friendly raw materials for handicrafts, packaging, and sustainable products, creating value for both people and planet.
